techmeme.title: Email: NYC-based Level, which raised a $27M Series A in 2021 to help companies offer staff benefits, shuts down after an effort to sell the company fell through (The Information)
Short seller Hindenburg shorts Carvana claiming the company's turnaround is a "mirage" that's being propped up by unstable loans and accounting manipulation (Michael Wayland/CNBC)
A US appeals court rules the FCC did not have legal authority to reinstate net neutrality rules; incoming FCC chair Brendan Carr opposed the 2024 reinstatement (David Shepardson/Reuters)
Meta appoints Joel Kaplan as Chief Global Affairs Officer, replacing Nick Clegg, who is leaving the company; Kaplan is Meta's most prominent Republican (Semafor)
The T3 Financial Crime Unit says it has frozen $100M of USDT used by illicit actors since the unit was formed in September 2024 by Tron, TRM Labs, and Tether (Sam Reynolds/CoinDesk)
